Player History
Drafted in 6th round, 102nd overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1970...
Injured on 5/19/1970 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 4/20/1973, off Dick Kelley (ATL)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/23/1973, off Vince Colbert (STL)...
Injured on 9/1/1976 with a Fractured Elbow, out for 8 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/4/1978, hitting .579 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/4/1979 to a 3-year deal worth $3,750,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Minnesota on 2/8/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $1,000,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Oakland on 7/11/1985...
